par.text: Dubnium is a radioactive, artificial metal. It was first obtained in 1967 in the town of Dubna by a team of Russian researchers, directed by G.H. Flerov from the United Institute for Nuclear Research. They bombarded americium-243 with neon-22 ions. In 1970 a group of American researchers directed by Albert Ghiorso also announced the successful preparation of the element, by the bombardment of californium-249 with ions of nitrogen-15. It was named after the town where it was first obtained. The most stable dubnium isotope is
Db, with a half-life of 34 seconds.
